label: Letter from Lamond Godwin to Senator Ernest F. Hollings
description: Letter from Lamond Godwin to Senator Ernest F. Hollings stating that a proposal by Isaiah Bennett to rehabilitate rural housing is under consideration.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value:
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR
EMPLOYMENT AND TRAINING ADMINISTRATION
WASHINGTON, D.C. 20213 

MAR 1 1978 

Honorable Ernest F. Hollings
United States Senate
Washington, D.C. 20510

Dear Senator Hollings:

Thank you for your recent letter transmitting a proposal
from Mr. Isaiah Bennett, President, South Carolina State
Chapter of the A. Philip Randolph Institute. Mr. Bennett
is seeking your assistance in obtaining funds from the
Department of Labor for a program to rehabilitate 
rural, privately owned housing by training and employing
rural youth in home rehabilitation. At the present time,
this proposal is under active consideration by the
Department.

I appreciate your interest in this matter and regret the
delay in responding to your letter. Should you have any
additional questions, please contact my office.

Sincerely,

LAMOND GODWIN
Administrator
Office of National Programs
